title: What is the meaning of a back end developer and a front end developer? - Quora

response.answer_text: Web development generally refers to the less related aspect of website design, which includes the use of programming languages, markup, and scripting to develop functionality and functionality. Developers focus on the technical part of building a website, such as designing, programming, and integrating apps and graphics. Front development Front-end development is the part of web development that codes and creates front-end elements of a website, which are functions that are directly visible and accessible to the end-user or customer. Basically, a front-end developer is responsible for everything they see and works to improve the user experience to be transparent. They help create the overall design and aesthetics, as well as debugging and using static code analysis. Front-end developer skills Front-end developers are responsible for implementing visual components on a website, as well as interactive features such as navigation, buttons, or anything that improves overall usability. HTML, JavaScript, and CSS are often used to make sure that the visual (or client-side) side of a site is functioning properly so that users can interact with it freely and comfortably. While some front-end developers take care of web design, others work with mockups from a web designer. Skills required for a front-end developer job include: Good command of front-end programming languages The ability to create a responsive layout. Knowledge of testing and debugging. Understanding of front-end development tools and features, such as automation, content management systems, version control systems, APIs, and frameworks. Front-end developer jobs Front-end jobs range from developers who are proficient in a specific coding language to those with a variety of skills beyond the front-end. Since the interface involves visual aesthetics, these jobs can also include graphic design and content. There are many skills that overlap between different jobs, and specific titles can mean different things for each business. Front End Jobs: Front End DeveloperCSS / HTML DeveloperFront-end web designerFront End SEO ExpertFull-Stack DeveloperUI Developer Back-end development Back-end development is aptly named for web development that occurs behind programs. Unlike front-end development, which focuses on products and programs for customers, back-end development is about server-side logic and web application integration. Back-end developers write code to help a database and an application communicate. Basically, a backend developer handles what you can't see; They are in charge of the back end of a website, which includes servers, databases, and applications. Back-end developer skills Back-end developers make web pages and applications work through back-end languages. They also monitor the operation of the site and make changes and updates to improve the functionality behind the scenes. Some of the skills required for back-end developer jobs include: Database managementUsing the frameworkProgrammingKnowledge of accessibility and security compliance.Back-end developer jobsBackend developer jobs generally require a solid knowledge of programming. Some companies are looking for developers who have in-depth skills in a specific language, while others may need the ability to program in multiple languages. A small organization might want someone who can work both upstream and downstream, in other words, a full developer. Back-end Jobs: Back-end developerJava DeveloperFull-Stack DeveloperDevOps EngineerSoftware engineerIOS Developer

These two roles are very different from each other. Let me start with Backend Developer. Backend Developer is the one who write the main functionality of the product, how it behave and how it worked. Let take an example of YouTube , the backend functionality in this site is the how to run video and how to maintain your account when you upload, like and comment. The technology used for backend are python, mysql, PHP etc. Whereas FrontEnd developer is for how the website looks to the user. It usability and feasibility to the user when someone's uses it. The technology used is html, CSS , Javascript, jquery etc.
